channel.title: I'm back with a New HTML tutorial! :)
channel.description: [center][size=15pt][b]FINISHED! :)[/b][/size][/center] OK, First of all Just wanted to clear up on what HTML stands For: [b]Hyper Text Markup Language[/b]. [color=red]The codes that you would use to start and end an HTML code would be the following: [code] [/code] So that means that "" would be the start of the HTML code, and the "" would mean its the end of the code. Now moving onto the title, The text it dislplays at the top of your browser. First off you would have to enter this between the " tags. [code] [/code] This tells you that this is the "head" of your code. But to display the title you would do it like so: [code] TITLE_OF_BROWSER [/code] Well of course, the tells the browser to display this at the top of your browser. And last for this part of the tutorial the body of your code. This is where you would put the text that would be inside your HTML code. [code] <body> </body> [/code] And like its states above, This is the body of the code. Here, I'm going to explain something simple. Like an HTML link. [code] <a href="http://www.moparisthebest.com"> Moparscape</a> [/code] You would start off the code with "<a href" and end the code with "</a>" You should always be putting in the "http://" When making the link to another website. If you are going to do a link on the same website then you could just do something like this:[code] <a href="smf"> Moparisthebest Forums</a> [/code] So the thing that is different in this code is that you dont have to add in "http://www." All You would have to do is add in what the page it will be going to on the same website is. So in the code above it would go to "moparisthebest.com/smf" Because I put "sms" inside the Code. Where it says "Moparisthebest Forums" is where you would display the text you want the link to say. Moving On, Adding a background color. You would start with the "<html</html>" codes. (in the following code I'm not adding in the the title) Here is the code, I will explain the code right after it: [code] <html> <body bgcolor="blue"> <b>!!! I HAVE A BLUE BACKGROUND !!!</b> </body> </html> [/code] Ok explaing the "<body bgcolor". The "bgcolor" really means "BackGround Color". When doing a bgcolor you do not have to add in the special color codes like "F0000". Even though you started the code with "<body bgcolor", You only have to end it with "</body>" OK Now to finish up the tutorial. Drop Down Menus. As always we will start off with the two tags, "<html> & <body>". To name the code you would add in "<select name="HELLO:)">" (This is not required!). Next you woud add in "<option value="NAME_YOUR_SELECTION">". If you would like it to open up a webpage instead of naming your selection you would add in "http://YOURWEBSITE.com". Connected with this same peice of code you would add in "WHAT_YOU_WANT_THE_TEXT_TO_SAY</option>". Once you are ending the code you would add in the following tags. </select> </body> </html> Here is an example of your code! [code] <html> <body> <select name="Example:)"> <option value="http://www.moparisthebest.com">MOPARISTHEBEST</option> <option value="moparscape">Moparscape</option> <option value="cabby">Cabby Rocks ;)</option> </select> </body> </html> [/code] Thanks for reading my tutorial :) -Cabby

item.title: I'm back with a New HTML tutorial! :)
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

[quote=“Cabby, post:5, topic:62222”][quote author=lothy link=topic=89747.msg947904#msg947904 date=1172670335]
You should start posting tutorials based on XHTML standards - HTML is a little on the old side.
[/quote]

O.K. I’m grounded ATM But when I get back on again for a bit I’ll post it![br][size=1]Posted on: March 05, 2007, 05:56:27 PM[/size][hr][quote author=wonderguy6 link=topic=89747.msg947906#msg947906 date=1172670449]
all those colours. could you change for me please?

/sensible wonderguy6.
[/quote]

Well since I’m finishing this Tutorial right now, No. But on my XHTML tutorial that I am posting in a little while I’ll be sure to not add in the colors.

-Cabby[/quote]
Well its hard to see some of the things you typed.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm back with a New HTML tutorial! :)
item.dc:creator: @Cabby Cabby
item.description:
@Cabby wrote:

[center][size=15pt]FINISHED! [/size][/center]
OK, First of all Just wanted to clear up on what HTML stands For: Hyper Text Markup Language.
[color=red]The codes that you would use to start and end an HTML code would be the following:

<html>
</html>

So that means that “” would be the start of the HTML code, and the “” would mean its the end of the code.
Now moving onto the title, The text it dislplays at the top of your browser.
First off you would have to enter this between the " tags.

<head>
</head>

This tells you that this is the “head” of your code. But to display the title you would do it like so:

<title>TITLE_OF_BROWSER</title>

Well of course, the tells the browser to display this at the top of your browser.
And last for this part of the tutorial the body of your code. This is where you would put the text that would be inside your HTML code.

<body>
</body>

And like its states above, This is the body of the code.

Here, I’m going to explain something simple. Like an HTML link.

<a href="http://www.moparisthebest.com">
Moparscape</a>

You would start off the code with “<a href” and end the code with “”
You should always be putting in the “http://” When making the link to another website.
If you are going to do a link on the same website then you could just do something like this:[code]

Moparisthebest Forums
[/code]
So the thing that is different in this code is that you dont have to add in “http://www.” All You would have to do is add in what the page it will be going to on the same website is.
So in the code above it would go to “moparisthebest.com/smf” Because I put “sms” inside the Code.
Where it says “Moparisthebest Forums” is where you would display the text you want the link to say.

Moving On, Adding a background color.
You would start with the “<html” codes. (in the following code I’m not adding in the the title)
Here is the code, I will explain the code right after it:

<html>
<body bgcolor="blue">
<b>!!! I HAVE A BLUE BACKGROUND !!!</b>
</body>
</html>

Ok explaing the “<body bgcolor”. The “bgcolor” really means “BackGround Color”. When doing a bgcolor you do not have to add in the special color codes like “F0000”.
Even though you started the code with “<body bgcolor”, You only have to end it with “”

OK Now to finish up the tutorial. Drop Down Menus. As always we will start off with the two tags, " & ". To name the code you would add in “” (This is not required!).
Next you woud add in “”. If you would like it to open up a webpage instead of naming your selection you would add in “http://YOURWEBSITE.com”. Connected with this same peice of code you would add in “WHAT_YOU_WANT_THE_TEXT_TO_SAY”. Once you are ending the code you would add in the following tags.

Here is an example of your code! [code] MOPARISTHEBEST Moparscape Cabby Rocks ;) [/code]

Thanks for reading my tutorial

-Cabby

Read full topic
item.source: I'm back with a New HTML tutorial! :)
